q_text: What does someone typically feel when applying for a job?
taskA_pos:
Anxiety is the feeling of fear when doing something with an uncertain outcome.
Applying for a job has an uncertain outcome.
taskA_neg:
Horror is an intense feeling of fear or shock.
One won't feel horror when applying for a job.
Rejection might happen after interview.
Rejection would not happen while applying for a job.
Increased workload is not a feeling.
Being employed is not a feeling.
taskB: Anxiety is the feeling of fear when doing something with an uncertain outcome and applying for a job has an uncertain outcome. So one would typically feel anxiety and fear when applying for a job. One won't feel horror or rejection while applying for a job and the other options are not feelings.

q_text: Where do cars usually travel at very high speeds?
taskA_pos:
Racers compete on the race track
Competing involves going at high speed
Cars travel on a race track
taskA_neg:
Racers do not compete on the freeway
Racers do not compete on the road
Racers do not compete on the alley
Racers do not compete in the parking lot
taskB: Racers compete on the race track and not on the freeway, road, alley or in the parking lot. Competing involves going at high speed and cars travel on a race track.
